title: Peruvian court upholds 18-month pre-trial detention for Castillo
description: Ex-president Pedro Castillo denounces his arrest as 'political revenge,' while deadly protests continue to rock Peru.

title: ‘Forever a legend’: World pays tribute to Brazilian star Pele
description: Lula and Obama join scores of fans hailing the late football 'king' for his historic influence on and off the pitch.

title: Biden says he looks forward to working with Netanyahu’s new gov’t
description: US president calls Israeli prime minister 'friend for decades', ignores concerns about rise of far-right politicians.

title: Southwest Airlines promises stability after mass US cancellations
description: US Department of Transportation vows to investigate Southwest Airlines for cancellations following severe winter storm.

title: Skills, charisma, mysticism: The life of football legend Pele
description: The world bids farewell to one of the greatest footballers ever seen.

title: Brazilian football icon Pele leaves an unparalleled legacy
description: In his 21-year career, Brazilian footballer became the world's first truly global sporting superstar.

title: ‘The King’ Pele: A lifetime of football memories
description: Pele was feted as 'The King', a title given to him by playwright Nelson Rodrigues when he was just 17.

title: Top Algeria journalist in pretrial detention over funding charges
description: Ihsane El Kadi, who owns a media group and is a vocal critic of the government, has been placed in pretrial detention.

title: Brazilian football legend Pele dies at age 82
description: Pele, who had a tumour removed from his colon last year, passed away in a Sao Paolo hospital, his agent said.

title: How fragile is the peace between Serbs and Kosovars?
description: After weeks of protests, ethnic Serbs in Kosovo have agreed to take down the barricades amid hopes of tensions easing.

title: Brazil’s Lula picks Amazon defender to run environment ministry
description: The Lula government has promised to tackle deforestation, which reached record highs under the Bolsonaro administration.

title: Brazil’s haunting graveyard of ships risks environmental disaster
description: The Guanabara Bay by Rio de Janeiro and Niteroi, once a haven for wildlife, is now a cemetery for abandoned ships.

title: Belarus summons Ukraine envoy over stray air defence missile
description: Minsk says it downed a Ukrainian S-300 air defence missile amid a wave of Russian attacks on cities across Ukraine.

title: Who are the ministers leading Israel’s new far-right government?
description: Top ministers in Israel's new right-wing, religiously conservative cabinet headed by Netanyahu include illegal settlers.

description: Analysts say heightened friction in the Balkans may serve the Kremlin's interests but cast doubt over a show of force.

title: Indian pharma under scrutiny again after 18 Uzbek child deaths
description: Among the world's biggest rug exporters, India is investigating the firm whose cough syrup has been linked to the deaths

title: Setbacks swamped Donald Trump in 2022. Can he recover?
description: The year saw the former president face damaging political and legal crises as he announced his 2024 presidential run.

title: Italy orders COVID tests for China arrivals, EU seeks common rule
description: Italy imposes mandatory testing for air passengers from China, but other EU countries seem reluctant to follow suit.

title: Italy tightens rules for asylum seeker rescue ships
description: New measures could see charities who rescue asylum seekers at sea fined and their ships impounded.

title: Why there won’t be a ‘Hollywood ending’ to the Ukraine war
description: Russia and Ukraine will soon have to make awkward compromises if they don’t want their conflict to become a forever war.

description: Here’s a round-up of Al Jazeera’s Middle East coverage this week.

description: Israel's longest-serving premier has ushered in the country's most religious and hardline government in history.

description: Explosions rock Kyiv as Moscow launches wave of attacks stretching from Kharkiv in the east to Lviv in the west.

title: Israel is weaponising Palestinian children’s rights
description: Instead of disregarding child rights and international law, Israel is using them to perfect and justify its violence.

title: At least five killed in South Korea road tunnel fire
description: The blaze broke out after a freight truck collided with a bus on a highway near Seoul, injuring 37.

title: US clears sale of $180m anti-tank systems to Taiwan

description: Israel's incoming government has raised fears among Palestinians and liberal Israelis.

title: Russia rejects Zelenskyy’s ‘peace formula’: Lavrov

description: Burgeoning volunteer movement has taken on increasingly prominent role in supplying Russian troops fighting in Ukraine.

title: Japan eases COVID curbs on flights from Hong Kong after backlash

title: UN halts some operations in Afghanistan over women aid worker ban

title: Protesting Serbs in northern Kosovo agree to remove barricades

title: Twitter suffers major outage, leaving users unable to log on
description: Users attempting to log on to the microblogging site on Wednesday greeted with error message.

title: Argentina identifies another child kidnapped during dictatorship
description: The confirmation is the second to occur in less than a week, bringing the total number of identified children to 132.
